title: Trump Suggests Putin Summit Could Lead to Ukraine Negotiations
snippets: BBC Russia editor Steve Rosenberg and North America correspondent Anthony Zurcher consider the leaders' contrasting priorities as they prepare for talks on Ukraine.
Trump says the Alaska summit with Russian President Vladimir Putin could “set the table” for direct talks with Ukraine.

US president’s comment that Russian and Ukrainian leaders may have to ‘divvy’ things up likely to raise alarm

Donald Trump has said he believes Vladimir Putin is ready to make a deal on the war in Ukraine as the two leaders prepare for their summit in Alaska on Friday, but his suggestion th
The one-on-one format sought by the Kremlin maximizes the advantage of Putin’s experience and sets the stage for a well-worn playbook of half measures to drag out negotiations.
titles: What do Putin and Trump each want from the Alaska summit?
Trump: Putin ‘won’t mess around with me’ at Alaska summit
Putin ready to make Ukraine deal, Trump says before Alaska summit
How Putin, ex-KGB officer, will seek to sway Trump at Alaska summit
summary: During preparations for their summit in Alaska, President Donald Trump suggested that the meeting with Russian President Vladimir Putin could pave the way for direct negotiations with Ukraine. Trump's comment about the possibility of Russian and Ukrainian leaders having to "divvy things up" has sparked concerns. He expressed belief in Putin's readiness to strike a deal on the conflict in Ukraine, highlighting contrasting priorities as the leaders head into talks.

title: Broward Prosecutors Drop Battery Charge Against Browns' Judkins
snippets: Prosecutors have declined to file a formal misdemeanor battery charge against Browns rookie running back Quinshon Judkins, a spokesperson for the Broward State Attorney's Office in Florida told ESPN.
Judkins has yet to sign his rookie contract while the legal process played out

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMimwFBVV95cUxPeUloVFZUbUt4cVlSNDRJQ2Q1TTJiQ1h3Q0s3MXpLZDdVR3lDOHNfOXlZY1BYNWxjX0k1YWVCZF9DMzRBMlBuR29xY1p2dkVyaEd4eXo3REF6cjNNc3E0SjlOZVE2UUlMS0RtRDBrXzh1ellrMnZLVFVCSnJiTlUybG51LUJERTZpYjNLR2E2MnlJRE5IdFQyU0YzNA?oc=5" target="_blank">Browns Rookie RB

Browns RB Quinshon Judkins will not face charge after July arrest for domestic violence
Browns Rookie RB Quinshon Judkins Won’t Be Charged in Domestic Violence Case - Sports Illustrated
summary: Prosecutors in Broward County, Florida, have decided not to file a misdemeanor battery charge against Cleveland Browns rookie running back Quinshon Judkins. This decision was confirmed by a spokesperson for the Broward State Attorney's Office. Judkins, who has not yet signed his rookie contract, was awaiting the outcome of the legal process.

title: Global Plastic Pollution Treaty Talks End Without Agreement
snippets: Negotiations aimed at tacking plastic pollution have concluded without an agreement. Countries differed on how ambitious the treaty should be and whether to focus on cutting plastic production or waste management.

Countries deadlocked on whether legally binding deal should include curbs on production and toxic chemicals

Once again negotiators will leave the plastic summit thi

Talks aimed at striking a landmark global treaty on plastic pollution fell apart Friday without agreement, as countries failed to find consensus on how the world should tackle the ever-growing scourge.
titles: UN talks on plastic pollution fail to reach deal
Plastic pollution talks fail as negotiators in Geneva reject draft treaties
World plastic pollution treaty talks collapse with no deal
summary: Negotiations to create a global treaty on plastic pollution ended without an agreement. Countries could not agree on the treaty's ambition level, whether to focus on reducing plastic production or improving waste management, and if it should include legally binding measures to curb production and address toxic chemicals. The talks aimed at addressing the increasing issue of plastic pollution concluded with no consensus reached.

title: U.S. Government Investment Boosts Intel, Stocks Hit High Since March
snippets: Talks for an undisclosed stake come days after President Donald Trump called for Intel’s CEO to resign.
Trump administration in talks to take Intel stake, reports say &
The U.S. government's stake in Intel would help fund factories it's currently building in Ohio, according to the report.
titles: US government in talks to take stake in Intel: Report
Trump administration in talks to take Intel stake, reports say - Axios
Intel stock climbs 7% on report Trump administration is considering stake in chipmaker
summary: The U.S. government plans to invest in Intel, supporting the construction of new factories in Ohio. This development positively impacted Intel's stock, which achieved its highest value since March, recovering from a significant drop experienced in late July.

title: Apple Drops Blood Oxygen Sensor in US Watches After Patent Ruling
snippets: In 2023, the International Trade Commission found that Apple's blood oxygen sensors infringed on intellectual property from Masimo.
Apple is bringing blood oxygen monitoring back to some Apple Watches with an update after a US Customs ruling.
Feature had been removed from US Apple Watches after Apple lost a patent fight.
titles: Apple Watch getting redesigned blood oxygen feature following legal dispute
What Apple's big win with its blood oxygen feature means for your watch
Apple Watch gets reformulated, non-patent-infringing blood oxygen monitoring
summary: In 2023, the International Trade Commission determined that Apple's blood oxygen sensors violated Masimo's intellectual property. As a result, Apple removed this feature from its US watches following a patent dispute.

title: Michael Phelps Gives Swim Lessons to Ravens After Humphrey's Request
snippets: 23-time Olympic gold medalist gave words of wisdom to Ravens before offering up swim lessons.
Baltimore Ravens cornerback Marlon Humphrey posted a video on social media two weeks ago asking Olympic legend Michael Phelps to teach many of his teammates to swim.
titles: Michael Phelps offers swim lessons at Ravens training camp
Michael Phelps Teaches Baltimore Ravens To Swim After Players Reach Out For Help
summary: 23-time Olympic gold medalist Michael Phelps shared advice with the Baltimore Ravens and offered swim lessons after cornerback Marlon Humphrey's social media request. Humphrey had posted a video two weeks prior, asking Phelps for swimming lessons for his teammates.

title: Wayne Rooney Responds to Tom Brady's Criticism on Work Ethic
snippets: Former Birmingham City manager Wayne Rooney has said Tom Brady's criticism about his work ethic was "unfair."
England soccer great Wayne Rooney has some beef with Tom Brady after some pointed comments by the NFL superstar in a fly-on-the-wall documentary.
titles: Rooney: Brady work ethic criticism was 'unfair'
Wayne Rooney ‘disappointed’ with Tom Brady over work ethic comments in documentary
summary: Former England captain and Birmingham City manager, Wayne Rooney, has publicly responded to criticism from NFL star Tom Brady regarding his work ethic. Rooney described Brady's comments, which were made in a documentary, as "very unfair." The dispute highlights a rare public disagreement between two high-profile athletes from different sports.

title: Taylor Swift Reveals New Album Details, Discusses Personal Life on Podcast
snippets: The superstar debuted on Jason and Travis Kelce's "New Heights" podcast, talked about becoming a football fan.
Taylor Swift used an appearance on her boyfriend's podcast to reveal the album cover to her next record, “The Life of a Showgirl.”
titles: Taylor talks ball: Highlights from Swift's appearance on 'New Heights' podcast
Taylor Swift’s ‘New Heights’ Appearance Briefly Topped Trump’s Joe Rogan Episode
summary: Taylor Swift announced the release date, cover art, and track list for her new album, "The Life of a Showgirl." In a rare public discussion, she opened up about her relationship with Travis Kelce, her efforts to buy back her masters, and her recovery from the Eras Tour. Swift shared these insights while appearing on Jason and Travis Kelce's "New Heights" podcast, where she also talked about becoming a football fan.

title: Farage Urges PM to Address Lords Representation for Reform UK
snippets: Reform has four MPs in the House of Commons and controls ten councils in England, but currently has no peers.

Party leader calls on PM to address ‘democratic disparity’, claiming it is unfair that parties with fewer MPs are represented

Nigel Farage has called for the right to nominate Reform UK supporters to the House of Lords, claiming this would address a “democratic disparity”.

In a letter
titles: Nigel Farage urges PM to appoint Reform peers to House of Lords
Farage urges Starmer to appoint Reform peers to House of Lords
summary: Nigel Farage, leader of Reform UK, which has four MPs and controls ten councils in England but no peers in the House of Lords, has called on the Prime Minister to address what he terms a "democratic disparity." Farage argues that it is unfair for parties with fewer MPs to have representation in the Lords and is advocating for the right to nominate Reform UK supporters to the House of Lords to rectify this imbalance.

title: Trump-Putin Summit Set in Alaska, Echoing Historical Ties
snippets: For Trump-Putin summit about possible land swaps, Alaska is an appropriate venue, 158 years after it exchanged hands.
The Trump-Putin summit will take place in a former Russian colony that the United States bought for $7.2 million in 1867. Here’s how the deal came together and why its legacy matters.
titles: Why did Russia sell Alaska to the United States?
Why Russia Sold Alaska to the U.S.
summary: The Trump-Putin summit is scheduled to occur in Alaska, a location significant for being a former Russian colony acquired by the United States in 1867 for $7.2 million. This meeting, taking place 158 years after the territory's purchase, highlights the historical context and enduring legacy of the Alaska deal.

title: MacIntyre Leads BMW Championship by 3 After Storm-Delayed 62
snippets:
Robert MacIntyre carded a brilliant 62 to hold a three-shot lead after day one
of the BMW Championship at Caves Valley Golf Club, the second event of the FedExCup Playoffs.

Robert MacIntyre seized on a softer Caves Valley after a two-hour storm delay and rode the best putting round of his year with six straight birdies to post an 8-under 62 for a three-shot lead over Tommy Fleetwood in the BMW Championship on Thursday.
titles: MacIntyre storms ahead of Scheffler and McIlroy at BMW Championship
Robert MacIntyre runs off six straight birdies to lead BMW Championship
summary: Robert MacIntyre took a three-shot lead at the BMW Championship at Caves Valley Golf Club with an 8-under 62, after a two-hour storm delay. He achieved this with the best putting round of his year, including six straight birdies. Tommy Fleetwood trails him by three shots after the first day of the second FedExCup Playoffs event.

title: Deadly Cholera Outbreak in Sudan Claims 40 Lives, MSF Warns of Worsening Crisis
snippets: Thousands at risk as foreign aid cuts hit humanitarian efforts.
International charities warned that, left unchecked, the disease’s spread might exacerbate similar outbreaks across the African region for weeks or months to come.
titles: What’s driving Sudan’s worst cholera outbreak in years?
Sudan Hit by Its ‘Worst Cholera Outbreak’ in Years, Medical Charity Says
summary: A deadly cholera outbreak in Sudan, described as the worst in years by Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF), has resulted in at least 40 deaths in the last week. Factors such as displacement, war, and heavy rain, particularly in the Darfur region, have exacerbated the situation by limiting access to clean water. MSF has highlighted the urgency of the crisis as thousands depend on contaminated water sources. International charities have expressed concern that without intervention, the outbreak could worsen and spread across the African region for an extended period.

title: Wholesale Prices Surge in July, Sparking "Veggie-flation" Concerns
snippets: Veggie-flation strikes, with a warning for grocery prices
Inflation warning: Wholesale prices surge in July  Axios
The producer price index — which measures inflation before it hits consumers — was up 0.9% last month from June and 3.3% from a year earlier, much higher than expected.
titles: Veggie-flation strikes, with a warning for grocery prices - Axios
Inflation warning: Wholesale prices surge in July - Axios
Another tariff warning sign as wholesale inflation surges unexpectedly in July
summary: Inflation concerns are rising as wholesale prices surged in July, with the producer price index increasing by 0.9% from June and 3.3% from a year earlier, surpassing expectations. This hike in wholesale prices is a warning sign for future grocery prices, indicating a potential rise in the cost of vegetables and other goods, a phenomenon being referred to as "veggie-flation."

title: DOJ's Sean Dunn Fired After Throwing Sandwich at Border Officer
snippets: Sean Dunn was fired from the Department of Justice after video appeared to show him hurling a deli sandwich at an officer.

DOJ fires sandwich thrower after he's charged with assaulting officer in Washington, DC
summary: Sean Dunn was terminated from his position at the Department of Justice following the emergence of a video where he is seen throwing a deli sandwich at a U.S. Customs and Border Protection officer. The incident was publicized by FBI Director Kash Patel, who shared the video depicting the act.

title: Crew-11 Delivers New Farming Experiments to ISS on August 1, 2025
snippets: When the Crew-11 astronauts launched to the International Space Station on August 1, 2025, they carried with them another chapter in space farming: the latest VEG-03 experiments, complete with seed pillows ready for planting.

When the Crew-11 astronauts launched to the International Space Station on August 1, 2025, they carried with them another chapter in space farming: the latest VEG-03 experiments, complete with seed pillows ready for planting. Growing plants provides nutrition for astronauts, as well as psychological
titles: Astronauts launch space agriculture with seed pillows
Astronauts Plant Seed Pillows in New Space Agriculture Study
summary: On August 1, 2025, the Crew-11 astronauts transported the latest VEG-03 experiments, including seed pillows, to the International Space Station, marking a significant step in space farming. This endeavor aims to enhance astronauts' nutrition and psychological well-being by growing plants in space.

title: Florida to Consider Reopening Apalachicola Bay for Oyster Harvesting
snippets: Florida wildlife officials have given preliminary approval to a plan to reopen Apalachicola Bay for oyster harvesting, five years after the waters were closed due to dwindling shellfish populations.
titles: Florida wildlife officials consider reopening bay nationally known for its oysters
summary: Florida wildlife officials have preliminarily approved a plan to reopen Apalachicola Bay for oyster harvesting, following a five-year closure because of declining shellfish numbers. The decision signals progress towards potentially resuming oyster harvesting activities in the area.

title: Psychologists Use AI in Quest for Unified Cognition Theory
snippets: Psychology wants a unified theory of cognition. So far, no deal. By using generative AI and LLMs as a model of cognition, maybe we'll get there. Here's the inside scoop.
titles: Psychology Aims For A Unified Theory Of Cognition And AI Will Be A Big Help To Get There
summary: Psychologists are striving to develop a unified theory of cognition, but have not yet succeeded. Recent efforts include utilizing generative artificial intelligence (AI) and large language models (LLMs) as potential models for understanding cognition. This approach is still in the exploratory phase, with the aim of achieving a breakthrough in the field.

title: Cambridge Researchers Achieve Breakthrough in Terahertz Radiation Control
snippets: Researchers at the Cavendish Laboratory, University of Cambridge have demonstrated a new way to control radiation in the terahertz range—an often-overlooked part of the electromagnetic spectrum—with unprecedented dynamic range and speed. The findings could open the door to advanced technologies in c
titles: Graphene capacitors achieve rapid, high-depth modulation of terahertz waves
summary: Researchers at the University of Cambridge's Cavendish Laboratory have developed a method to control terahertz radiation with unparalleled dynamic range and speed. This innovation has the potential to advance various technologies, including communications and imaging systems, by harnessing a part of the electromagnetic spectrum that has been relatively underexploited.

title: Retailers Urged to Prep Now for Black Friday 2025 with Hybrid Focus
snippets: Retailers aiming to win Black Friday 2025 should start preparing now, focusing on hybrid shopping, mobile-first design, logistics, and operational stress testing.

summary: To succeed in Black Friday 2025, retailers are advised to begin preparations immediately, emphasizing the importance of hybrid shopping experiences, prioritizing mobile-first design, enhancing logistics, and conducting operational stress tests to ensure efficiency and resilience.

title: Weaver Ants Boost Productivity in Larger Groups, Study Finds
snippets: Weaver ants have cracked a teamwork puzzle that humans have struggled with for over a century — instead of slacking off as their group grows, they work harder. These tiny architects not only build elaborate leaf nests but also double their pulling power when more ants join in. Using a “force ratchet
titles: The surprising ant strategy that could transform robotics
summary: Weaver ants exhibit increased productivity and teamwork as their group size expands, contrary to the common issue of reduced individual effort in larger human groups. They enhance their collective pulling strength for constructing complex leaf nests, utilizing a mechanism known as a "force ratchet" to effectively double their work output with more ants participating. This discovery highlights their exceptional collaborative abilities.

The specific details of the reforms and their implementation timeline were not disclosed.

summary: Austrian artist Jonas Griessler uses an infrared thermometer to measure extreme heat in a Vienna courtyard. This artistic project aims to highlight the impact of rising temperatures in urban areas. Griessler's work draws attention to the effects of climate change on city environments.

title: Ivory Coast Fisherman Digs Up Relatives to Save Them from Ocean Erosion
snippets: Fisherman Alphonse Akadie was forced to exhume the bodies of his relatives last year from the village cemetery in Ivory Coast to avoid their remains being carried off into the ocean.

summary: Alphonse Akadie, a fisherman in Ivory Coast, had to dig up his relatives' bodies from a village cemetery to prevent them from being washed away into the ocean. This drastic action was taken last year to protect the remains.

title: Researchers Uncover Complex Pest Dynamics on Puerto Rican Coffee Farm
snippets: In a Puerto Rican coffee farm, researchers uncovered a web of chaotic interactions between three ant species and a predator fly, revealing how shifting dominance patterns make pest management unpredictable. By combining theories of cyclic dominance and predator-mediated coexistence, they showed how
titles: Predator fly unleashes chaotic ant wars that could save coffee
summary: Researchers studying a Puerto Rican coffee farm discovered complex interactions among three ant species and a predator fly, demonstrating the unpredictability of pest management due to shifting dominance patterns. Their findings, which integrate cyclic dominance and predator-mediated coexistence theories, highlight the complexity of ecological relationships and the challenges in controlling pests in agricultural settings.

summary: On Independence Day, India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced tax cuts and policy reforms. He encouraged the production of high-quality goods domestically, criticizing the global rise in "economic selfishness." This move aims to boost India's economy and self-reliance.
